means: 横贯大陆的，大陆那边的，<主加>横穿大路的列车（或铁路）

sentence.Network_en: Big transcontinental enterprises jostle with one another for world markets.
sentence.Network_cn: 巨大的跨国公司[企业]互相争夺国际市场.
北方森林是横贯大陆的.

sentence.Network_en: The United States Government's land policy, transcontinental railway building and accelerate the development of the western.
sentence.Network_cn: 美国政府的土地政策, 横贯大陆铁路的建筑,加速了西部的开发.

entry.tran: 横贯大陆的;穿越大陆的;(美国英语中通常指)横穿美国的
entry.def: A transcontinental journey or route goes from one side of a continent to the other. In American English, transcontinental usually means from one side of the United States to the other.

example.ex: ...in mid-nineteenth-century America, before the transcontinental railroad was built.
example.tran: 19 世纪中期的美国，在横贯大陆的铁路建成之前

means.word_mean: 1. spanning or crossing or on the farther side of a continent;

auth_sentence.content: That means coach passengers will no longer traipse through first class on its transcontinental flights.
auth_sentence.res_content: That means coach passengers will no longer traipse through first class on its transcontinental flights.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That means coach passengers will no longer traipse through first class on its transcontinental flights.

auth_sentence.content: The world knows trains are most efficient to move cargo a long distance but, we have no high speed transcontinental cargo trains.
auth_sentence.res_content: The world knows trains are most efficient to move cargo a long distance but, we have no high speed transcontinental cargo trains.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The world knows trains are most efficient to move cargo a long distance but, we have no high speed transcontinental cargo trains.

auth_sentence.content: It was Abraham Lincoln who launched the Transcontinental Railroad and opened the National Academy of Sciences.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was Abraham Lincoln who launched the Transcontinental Railroad and opened the National Academy of Sciences.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was Abraham Lincoln who launched the Transcontinental Railroad and opened the National Academy of Sciences.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"变换,改变,转移"; 2. 表示"横过,越过"

stems_affixes.word_buile: trans变换,改变,转移+it走+ory……的→走过就变→短暂的
trans横过,越过+continental大陆的→adj.横贯大陆的
trans横过,越过+luc光+ent……的→穿过去看到光
trans横过,越过+noraml正常的→adj.超出常规的
trans横过,越过+par看见+ent……的→横穿过去看得一样清楚→透明的
trans横过,越过+vers转+e→adj.横向的, 横断的
trans变换,改变,转移+action行动→交换行动→交易

stems_affixes.value_cn: 运输;运输系统,运载工具
stems_affixes.word_buile: trans变换,改变,转移+port运→搬运转移→运输

trans变换,改变,转移+scribe写→把写的东西移到[另一张纸上]→抄写
trans变换,改变,转移+figure形状→改变形状

stems_affixes.value_cn: 改变,变换;变压;转化;改造,改造

trans变换,改变,转移+fuse流→[血]流过去→输血
trans变换,改变,转移+mogr怪形状+ify表动词→变成怪形状
trans变换,改变,转移+port运→搬运转移→运输
